results.title: How much affection?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marriage and Family Living”.
A social guidance docu-drama promoting restraint against premarital sex. After nearly succumbing to her boyfriend’s advances, teenager Laurie seeks her mother’s advice. Following a sensible discussion with her mother and the lesson provided by her friend Eileen, a victim of her physical urges, Laurie considers the long term consequences of sexual temptation.

results.title: Engagement: romance and reality
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marriage and Family Living”.
Presents a young couple who plan to marry. They love each other but do not really know each other; their images are unrealistic. They discover the values they hold are different and realise they must begin to see themselves and each other realistically in terms of marriage.

group_works.title: It's all right, it's only a customer

results.title: The Competitive spirit (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Marketing in Practice”.
Deals with one of the best known and least documented problems of corporate management: status-seeking, empire-building and interdepartmental politics. Stimulates managers and executives to look at their behavior, their motives and the problems of corporate communication in a new light. Cast: John Cleese, Antony Jay.

Episode number 3 of Series “Marketing in Practice”.
Deals with one of the best known and least documented problems of corporate management - status-seeking, empire-building and interdepartmental politics. Stimulates managers and executives to look at their behaviour, their motives and the problems of corporate communication in a new light. Cast includes John Cleese, Peter Bayliss. group_siblings.title: It's all right, it's only a customer

results.title: It's all right, it's only a customer
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Marketing in Practice”.
John Cleese plays four different Herberts - head office employees who have lost touch with the real world of customers and the company business. Ronnie Barker plays a long-suffering customer who is passed from one Herbert to another in his attempt to place a slightly non-standard order. Cast also includes Jonathan Lynn, Connie Booth, Bernard McKenna, Renny Lister. Narrated by Keith Barron.

results.title: Who sold you this then? (NP)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Marketing in Practice”.
John Cleese is Charlie Jenkins, the Service Engineer. The film shows how he can destroy the reputation of his company and its products every time he talks to a customer. It also shows how he could be his company’s best ambassador. It is an object lesson for everyone in the company who has to deal directly with customers.

group_works.title: Does advertising pay?
group_works.creator_credit: Alan Strowger, Tony Matthews and BBC-TV

results.title: Does advertising pay?
results.creator_credit: Alan Strowger, Tony Matthews and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marketing”.
In 1965 British industry spent nearly 600 million pounds on advertising and sales promotion. Was the money well spent? Part of a series of films designed to present the theory and practice of modern marketing. Case histories of branded products (failures as well as successes) are given to illustrate particular market problems.

results.title: The New distribution
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marketing”.
One of a marketing series which specifically deals with the problem of “How do you get your product from the shop floor to the high street?”. The series explores the whole range of marketing activities involved in moving a product or service from the factory to the consumer.
